entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 2:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Thursday into Saturday Morning... Elevated surf is expected to develop along the coast near the Yukon Delta and St Lawrence Island. North to northeasterly winds will increase Thursday morning to 30 to 45 mph with gusts to 60 mph. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for north facing coastal areas of St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta. Winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 7:42AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Areas of fog developed during the night in northern Delaware. The fog will continue to reduce the visibility to a half mile or less in spots. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 03 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... The Florida Department of Environmental Protection has issued an Air Quality Alert due to elevated levels of Particulate Matter of 2.5 micrometers or less until 8 AM EDT Wednesday. Members of sensitive groups may experience adverse health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 9:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall over and upstream from Astor combined with northeast winds have brought the Saint Johns River at Astor into Moderate Flood. River levels are forecast to remain in Moderate Flood between 3.0 and 3.1 feet through the weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 6:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog have developed this morning across eastern New York and western New England, especially in valley areas and near rivers, streams, and lakes. Visibilities will be reduced to one quarter of a mile or less at times. The fog will impact the morning commute. Motorists are advised to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 4:58AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Fog this Morning... Locally dense fog will reduce visibility below one half mile in spots through the early morning peak commute hours. Fog will most concentrated in river valleys. Be prepared to slow down if driving and keep a safe following distance. The fog should dissipate after 9 AM.
